title: What are the chances of riot lifting perma bans
body: So far i've gone through a 14 day ban and playing my heart out to reform and get honor back. Though since everyone is getting banned nowadays one word and its gg for me to most likely. But has there ever been a case where riot has lifted a perma? No offense but riot seem like tightasses and wouldn't do such a thing even if the player reformed. thoughts?

replies.body:
The system is more highly strung than it has ever been.

my suggestion - unbind enter from chat and mute all. it is the only way to be sure.

> [{quoted}](name=Essembie,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=e1ycHIdW,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-12-18T18:54:44.288+0000)
>
> The system is more highly strung than it has ever been.
> 
> my suggestion - unbind enter from chat and mute all. it is the only way to be sure.

Nah, then you get banned for not communicating (which falls under griefing from memory)

Not communicating (in the griefing category) is more along the lines of running up top all game or sitting in the jungle and ignoring everything else. You can communicate just fine with pings or even just by being aware of what your team is doing.
I mean, non-communication should never be bannable, and staying in your own lane shouldn't ever get you a ban XD
That's why the category is griefing. It has to be more than just not talking.

the most risk free way is to mute all, unbind chat, and use the pings that riot gave us.

All the tools are there.  it is just a shame that it has come to this.
Not if you're using Pings. That's part of the reason why pings are there, so players can effectively/semi-effectively communicate without using chat (whether by choice or not).

as long as u make them the money, u think they care?

look at tyler1, leading so much of his immatured viewers to be toxic.

yeah i got 14 day banned a few months ago for saying "kys %%%" as a joke to my thresh

I'm not saying bad behaviour should be tolerated, but its quite stringent and severe
A perma ban will not be removed unless it was made in error.
